fr.sorbonne_u.components.hem2022e3.equipments.heater

Interface HeaterSensorCI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.ComponentInterface, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.DataOfferedCI, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.DataRequiredCI, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.OfferedCI, java.rmi.Remote, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.RequiredCI

    public interface HeaterSensorCI
extends fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.DataRequiredCI, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.DataOfferedCI
    The component interface HeaterSensorCI declares the interfaces that sensor data exchanged through it must implement.

    Description

    This component interface extends BCM4Java data interfaces. These interfaces are meant to implement more simply the communication of data among two components. The other interesting point about data interfaces is that they allow two way communication i.e., data can be either pushed by the emitter towards the receiver or the receiver can pull the data from the emitter. In the case of the heater components, the push mode will fit the requirement for notifying the controller when the heater is switched on and off, so that the controller can begin or stop its closed-loop control of the temperature and the heating. On the other hand, when the controller needs the current and target temperatures, it will use the pull mode.

    Black-box Invariant

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Created on : 2022-10-27

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  HeaterSensorCI.SensorDataI
      The interface SensorDataI declares the methods common to all sensor data exchanged between the controlled and the controller components.
      static interface  HeaterSensorCI.StateDataI
      The interface BooleanDataI declares the methods to access a boolean value in a boolean sensor data.
      static interface  HeaterSensorCI.TemperatureDataI
      The interface TemperatureDataI declares the methods to access the target and the current temperatures as sensed by the heater.
